page.title: 08Redlands
page.content: Redlands is a firm that produces washed sand and gravel. The sand is used for building and for making readymix concrete. There are two departments - Redland Readymix makes concrete and Redlands Aggregates Ltd. digs and produces the sand. The production at this site has been closed for eight years. At the moment the site is just a railhead but there is a working quarry at East Peckham. Eight hundred people are employed at Redlands which also uses Loading Shovels, Dumptrucks, Dragline Excavators, Bulldozers and Motorscrapers. The pits are now left for wildfowl reserves, watersports, and fishing. Redlands was started in the 1940s. They have 38 sites in the U.K. Products include tiles, bricks, roadmarkings, tarmac, granite, and roof trusses.
